This was a controversial topic to bring into academia in 1989 - at least, at UCLA and elsewhere.
Terry Wilson taught a course - beginning in the late '70s, at UC Berkeley - a very large class.
He was in the - I think it was anthropology, American-Indian studies and ethnic studies there.

And Paul Spickard, historian here, and Teresa Williams-Leon - Teresa organized the very first class at UC Santa Barbara, that led to this issue as it relate - related to people of Asian-American background.
